lead_paragraph: Pat Riley has ended months of speculation about his immediate future by announcing that he will be on the Miami Heat bench for three more seasons.Riley, 62, gave up coaching in 2003, then returned two years later and led the Heat to the 2006 N.B.A. title. The Heat was eliminated from the first round of the 2007 playoffs and Riley was noncommittal about whether he would return.Riley trails only Lenny Wilkens and Don Nelson in regular-season victories, with 1,195.
